intro: Dubautia sherffiana, commonly known as the Hawaiian red hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to the island of Maui in Hawaii. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its striking red or orange tubular flowers that bloom in summer. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine, soft hairs, while its stems are woody and often branched. Dubautia sherffiana is adapted to the dry, sunny conditions of its native habitat and plays an important role in the local ecosystem.
